pGUI.core

Class Frame

  • java.lang.Object
    • pGUI.core.Control
      • pGUI.core.Container
        • pGUI.core.Frame

  • public class Frame
extends Container
    Master Container that fills out entire sketch and controls the flow of events and rendering of the GUI.

    • Field Detail

      • frame0

        public static Frame frame0
        This is a static Frame that when a new Frame object is created is initialized with this exact Frame. It is available to all classes for exchanging information. Normally a programmer does not need it except when developing custom Component classes. Only one Frame may exist per sketch.

      • DRAW_PRE

        public static final int DRAW_PRE
        GUI Draw time Mode: Draw the GUI before the PApplet.draw() happens. Useful when the user wants to image some own stuff upon the GUI. The draw time mode needs to be specified at the beginning when Frame is created. This is the default mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DRAW_POST

        public static final int DRAW_POST
        GUI Draw time Mode: Draw the GUI after the PApplet.draw() happens.The draw time mode needs to be specified at the beginning when Frame is created. Everything that is drawn during PApplet.draw() will be overwritten without ever being visible, except when Frame is transparent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONTINOUS

        public static final int CONTINOUS
        Draw frequency mode. Continous makes Frame draw the entire GUI EACH time (standard is 60 times per sec) if it hsa changed or not. This is useful if pGUI is combined with manual drawing on the sketch but it is the most wasteful mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EFFICIENT

        public static final int EFFICIENT
        Draw frequency mode. Only refresh if any Component has changed. It still keeps the PApplet.draw() loop running to check for some events but only redraws if necessary.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SUPER_EFF

        public static final int SUPER_EFF
        Most efficient mode (but not a lot more than EFFICIENT). The PApplet.draw() loops is interrupted and only key and mouse events are still received and can change the state of the GUI. Also animations have trouble working here (yet). This is the default and for many cases recommended mode.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • KEY_EVENT

        public static final int KEY_EVENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • GUI_INITIALIZED_EVENT

        public static final int GUI_INITIALIZED_EVENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WINDOW_RESIZE_EVENT

        public static final int WINDOW_RESIZE_EVENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOUSE_ENTER_WINDOW_EVENT

        public static final int MOUSE_ENTER_WINDOW_EVENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOUSE_EXIT_WINDOW_EVENT

        public static final int MOUSE_EXIT_WINDOW_EVENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • Frame

        public Frame(PApplet pa)
        It is necessary to pass the sketch object here. In most cases (if not in scope of a class) just use "this".
        Parameters:
        pa -

      • Frame

        public Frame(PApplet pa,
             int timeToDraw)
        Specify the draw time mode with this constructor.
        Parameters:
        pa -
        timeToDraw - DRAW_PRE or DRAW_POST

    • Method Detail

      • getPApplet

        public PApplet getPApplet()

      • papplet

        public static PApplet papplet()

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)
        Set draw frequency mode EFFICIENT CONTINOUS SUPER_EFF
        Parameters:
        mode - accepts Frame.EFFICIENT, Frame.CONTINOUS, Frame.SUPER_EFF

      • pre

        public void pre()
        DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD. It is automatically called by the sketch and needs to be public for that reason.

      • draw

        public void draw()
        DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD. It is automatically called by the sketch and needs to be public for that reason.

      • registerShortcut

        public boolean registerShortcut(Shortcut shortcut,
                                java.lang.String methodName)
        Register a global shortcut to the sketch and fire the given method when the combination is hit on the keyboard.
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.

      • registerShortcut

        public boolean registerShortcut(Shortcut shortcut,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target)
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        target - object that declares the callback method.
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.
        See Also:
        version with custom target object.

      • deregisterShortcut

        public boolean deregisterShortcut(Shortcut shortcut)
        If the shortcut has been removed returns true. This is not the case if given shortcut has never been registered. The given shortcut does not need to be THE exact same as the registered one. It can be a new one with the same attributes.
        Parameters:
        shortcut -
        Returns:
        true if deregistering has been successful.

      • registerShortcut

        public boolean registerShortcut(Shortcut shortcut,
                                java.lang.String methodName,
                                java.lang.Object target,
                                boolean global)
        Parameters:
        shortcut - shortcut to register
        methodName - method to execute when shortcut is pressed.
        target - object that declares the callback method.
        global - Should this shortcut even work when a textbox has focus?
        Returns:
        true if registering has been successful.
        See Also:
        If global is set to true then this shortcut will even work when a textbox has focus! Default is false.

      • stopPropagation

        public static void stopPropagation()
        Stop mouse event propagation. If called then no Components lower or at the same level in the Container hierachy will receive the currently processed mouse event.

      • isPropagationStopped

        public static boolean isPropagationStopped()
        Check if the mouse event propagation has been stopped.
        Returns:
        propagation stop state

        public void mouseEvent(MouseEvent e)
